intro: Stisseria vetula, commonly known as the Florida false buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. Stisseria vetula is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
